intro: Gavilea supralabellata, commonly known as the pink gavilea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively uncommon in horticulture.
